summary:
Postdoctoral researcher at Northeastern University in the Antimicrobial Discovery Center. 
PhD in Microbiology from Cornell University December 2021. Research areas 1) identification and characterization of novel compounds for control of Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb) infection; 2) Genetic (CRISPRi) and cellular approaches to interrogation of Mtb gene essentiality during infection

currentPositions.description:
Responsible for management and operational duties for the Antimicrobial Discovery Center (ADC), including but not limited to:
- Supervision, management, and mentorship of ADC research technicians and research assistants
- Procurement (Facilitating contract negotiations, requisition processing, etc)
- Project management, consultation, and delegation
- Enforcing lab safety practices; ensuring compliance with IBC and IACUC
- Facilitating grant report submissions
- Team event planning and organizing
- Serving as liaison between ADC and various university and external entities

message.text:
We're on the hiring train again! We are specifically looking for someone with both microbiology and mouse handling experience to join our in vivo and drug development team. We recently developed a bacterial pneumonia model for evaluating efficacy of novel antibiotics for treating lung infections. The antibiotics being developed were discovered by the larger Antimicrobial Discovery Center research team. Therefore, we need some additional support as we transition into this exciting new area! Please see job posting below for additional details. 

https://lnkd.in/ehKte4XQ

Additional Hiring Managers for this role: Dr. Bryson Hawkins and Dr. Kamrunnesa Tahmina

Watching my very first supervisee give the student speech at the Northeastern University College of Science’s graduation ceremony was such an incredible experience. Bishwarup Sarkar (to no one’s surprise) absolutely knocked it out of the park with perfect delivery of an excellent speech. Congratulations Bish, you continue to inspire everyone around you!

Many times over the past year of being a Manager it’s felt like I jumped in the deep end without any swimming lessons. Fortunately, our team has been patient and forgiving as I figure it out, especially while I am still a postdoctoral scientist and juggling challenges outside of work. Given all of this, I’m very honored to be nominated for Student Employee Supervisor of the Year at Northeastern University. Happy National Student Employment Week!

I’ve been incredibly fortunate with the quality and productivity of the research assistants I’ve had while at the ADC. Parth joined the team in January and has already made significant contributions in support of the Mtb drug development projects!

A bit late to the party, but wanted to announce that I'm super stoked to have started working as a Research Assistant at Antimicrobial Discovery Center (The Lewis Lab) at Northeastern University. 

The past couple of months have been exciting as I got to learn more about #antibiotics and their discovery & development through interesting experiments and assays. It is amazing to be working alongside Dr.Monique Theriault.

Heartfelt thanks to Monique Theriault for this opportunity. Looking forward to contributing more in the near future!
